history.content:
Please contact the School of Information. What makes you think you'd get an answer here?

~~~ 

Had a few friends who took it and said the material was pretty broad. I would lean towards they "realized the existing content was more work than 3 units" but I can't say for sure.
Please contact the School of Information. What makes you think you'd get an answer here?

children.subject: The important part is its a change to a tech elective. You cannot expect the EECS department to have class scheduling information about other departments.

Not OP, but this question seems like a perfectly reasonable question to ask. Info 159 isn't an uncommon tech elective for EECS/CS majors to take. It's not unreasonable to ask this question in a forum where both advisors and students respond to student questions. It's possible for a student who's taken Info 159 to know the answer, and OP wasn't "expecting" an answer. I think you just automatically assumed that, and dismissed their question on that sole basis. One quick glance at the questions asked this week indicated there are far more student responses than instructor/staff responses, just saying.

My point is, I am not sure how any student is supposed to know why the number of units for a class was changed from 3 to 4 (unless they have insider info, which is quite rare), as this purely a logistical issue. And the staff on this Piazza is from the EECS department.

OH here: The point of my question is to figure out if the unit count changing is only a logistical issue, rather than a content change. Tech electives are APPROVED by EECS dpt (and thus, this Piazza is applicable, btw), so when they change (for whatever reason), it's extremely reasonable to wonder if the EECS dpt knows any details surrounding the change, since may have to re-approve it if the content had changed.

I dont understand why you are so dismissive of my question when you literally could have just ignored it, let it go unanswered, and then maybe one of literally THOUSANDS of other students might know whats up. You cant possibly be so arrogant as to think you have perfect information about this subject.
I think he's planning on adding discussion section, which wasn't offered last year.
OP: It's not unreasonable to ask EECS 101 about a change to a tech elective... What makes you think none of the people in EECS 101 knows?

history.content:
I know Info 159 isnt in the EECS dpt (but it's a tech elective), but might anyone know why it is now 4 units (Fall 2018, src: guide.berkeley.edu & calcentral) instead of 3 (Fall 2017, src: ischool)?

I'm speculating that they decided to add more content, or realized the existing content was more work than 3 units, but these thoughts are unsubstantiated.
history.subject: Info 159 - now 4 units instead of 3
